title: Police: 13-year-old girl shot in head by teen relative carelessly handling gun
content:
LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) – A Louisville man was arrested early Wednesday morning, about three hours after shooting a 13-year-old relative in the head while carelessly handling a gun, according to his arrest report. The girl's condition is unknown, but a police spokesman said she is "stable."
The incident happened about 1:35 a.m. at a home in the 5600 block of Rustic Way in the Newburg neighborhood.
MUGSHOTS: October 2016 Roundup
Police said the suspect, Davon D. Powell, 18, left the home after the shooting and threw the gun into some bushes.
He was captured at 4:47 a.m. after a short foot pursuit from Lodema Way.

The arrest report says Powell confessed to the shooting and told police he ran away because he feared the weapon had been stolen. Police said in their report that they had not yet confirmed whether the gun had actually been stolen.
The exact relationship between the victim and suspect is not yet known.
